events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan request to cover medical expenses and consolidate existing debt to improve financial stability.
Loan application was categorised under personal loans due to keywords related to medical and debt consolidation purposes.
A loan officer specializing in personal loans was assigned to assist the applicant and guide through the process.
The initial review of the loan application was completed, verifying applicant eligibility and initial loan amount.
Requested detailed financial statements, medical bills, and proof of income to support the personal loan application.
Applicant provided all requested documents, including medical invoices and recent pay slips, to help complete the loan processing.
Credit check was performed revealing a moderate credit score, with no recent defaults noted on the applicant's credit report.
Risk assessment identified average risk associated with debt consolidation but highlighted stable income as a positive factor.
A loan offer was presented to the applicant detailing interest rates, repayment terms, and the total loan amount approved.
Applicant responded with questions regarding repayment schedules and requested clarification about possible early repayment penalties.
The application was escalated to a senior loan officer due to the applicant's concerns about loan terms and to negotiate adjustments.
Following review and negotiation, the personal loan was approved with revised terms to address applicantâ€™s feedback.
The approved loan amount was successfully disbursed to the applicant's bank account to cover medical expenses and debts.
Follow-up with applicant confirmed satisfaction with the loan process and repayment schedule, ensuring ongoing support.
The loan application case was closed after successful funding and positive follow-up, marking the conclusion of the process.
